item.title: Trails In The Sky 1st Chapter Preorders Are Available Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/trails-in-the-sky-1st-chapter-preorders-are-available-now/1100-6530827/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The game that kicked off the long-running Legend of Heroes RPG series is getting a remake with Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter, which launches on PS5, Nintendo Switch, and PC on September 25. The game is an all-new version of the original Trails in the Sky, remaking the PS3 and PS Vita game with full 3D high-res visuals, new voice acting, and overhauled gameplay. Whether you're a long-time fan of the series wanting to revisit the classic entry in a new way, or are looking to experience it for the first time, you can preorder physical copies now at Amazon and Best Buy.

Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter Preorder Bonuses

No preorder bonuses have been announced for Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter. We'll update this section if anything is revealed ahead of launch.

Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter is a remake of Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky. It will return players to where the long-running Trails series began. The game follows adoptive siblings Joshua and Estelle Bright, who join the Bracers peacekeeping organization. They're soon caught up in an international conspiracy and must join forces with various other characters to thwart a deadly coup. While it will maintain the same plot as the PS3 version, it uses the same engine as the latest entry in the series, Trails Through Daybreak, and will feature an all-new English voice acting class. There will also be a long list of gameplay changes, the most notable being the inclusion of two battle systems--one is a revised version of the original version's turn-based combat, and the other is a real-time system, and you'll be able to swap between on the fly.

Considering there are now 15 mainline games in the Trails series, giving new players a modernized way to experience the original as a jumping-on-point is a welcome decision. However, if you are looking to dive into the series now, your best option is to check out the Trails Through Daybreak sub-series, which marked the beginning of a new story arc in the sprawling series, making it another good starting point for newcomers. Its first sequel, Trails from Daybreak II, also launched earlier in 2025, and the third game in the arc, Trails of Beyond The Horizon, is also coming to PS5, PS4, Nintendo Switch, and PC this Fall. It doesn't have a specific release date yet, but preorders are already available, including a cool Deluxe Edition that includes a mini artbook and digital soundtrack for $60.

item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza Release Date, Trailer, Gameplay Details, And Everything We Know
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/donkey-kong-bananza-release-date-trailer-gameplay-details-and-everything-we-know/1100-6530797/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo's long-awaited Switch 2 system finally arrives on June 5, and the company is ushering it in with two marquee titles. Just a few weeks after the console hits the market alongside Mario Kart World, Nintendo will release Donkey Kong Bananza, a brand-new adventure game starring the iconic, banana-loving ape.

Bananza marks the first full 3D Donkey Kong title in over 20 years, and it's a stunning showpiece for the new system, featuring impressive visuals and fully destructible environments that DK can pummel with his earth-shattering punches. Nintendo will undoubtedly share more details about the game in the weeks leading up to its launch, but in the meantime, here's a roundup of everything we know so far about Donkey Kong Bananza.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • When Will Donkey Kong Bananza Be Released?
  • Preorder Donkey Kong Bananza
  • Price
  • Donkey Kong Bananza Trailer
  • Gameplay Details
  • Donkey Kong Bananza File Size
  • What Platforms Is Donkey Kong Bananza On?
  • Who's Developing Donkey Kong Bananza?

When Will Donkey Kong Bananza Be Released?

Donkey Kong Bananza launches for the Nintendo Switch 2 on July 17, 2025.

Preorder Donkey Kong Bananza

Preorders for both Donkey Kong Bananza and the Nintendo Switch 2 were initially slated to begin on April 9. However, both have been indefinitely delayed in the US and Canada as a result of newly enacted tariffs.

Nintendo has yet to confirm when preorders will now open, but the game and console are still scheduled to launch on their originally announced release dates.

Price

While some Nintendo Switch 2 games like Mario Kart World can be as expensive as $80, Donkey Kong Bananza will retail for $70.

Donkey Kong Bananza Trailer

Donkey Kong Bananza â€“ Official Gameplay Reveal Trailer | Nintendo Switch 2

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Nintendo dropped the first trailer for Donkey Kong Bananza at the end of its Switch 2-focused Nintendo Direct on April 2.

The video showcases Donkey Kong pummeling his way through a series of destructible environments, using his powerful punches to smash enemies and the terrain around him. The trailer also provides a brief look at the game's antagonists: a mysterious group of enemies known as VoidCo. who have swiped up the world's golden bananas.

Gameplay Details

Donkey Kong Bananza is the series' first full 3D installment since 1999's Donkey Kong 64, and it plays quite a bit differently from the N64 adventure.

Whereas past Donkey Kong games have emphasized platforming, Bananza is more action-oriented and leans into DK's imposing strength. The gorilla can use his mighty punches to destroy not only enemies, but the environment around him. He can also rip out chunks of terrain to use as makeshift weapons and even surf on the land.

DK's quest revolves around retrieving golden bananas, which were snatched up by a mysterious group of foes known as VoidCo. Like the Power Moons in Super Mario Odyssey, these bananas are littered around the environment and doled out for completing objectives, encouraging players to explore thoroughly.

Donkey Kong is accompanied on his journey by a strange talking purple rock, though what role it plays in the story is unclear. However, it seems that won't be the only sidekick who joins the ape. A leaked image also suggests that a young girl who looks suspiciously like Pauline will accompany DK at some point in the game, although nothing has been confirmed as of yet.

Donkey Kong Bananza File Size

If you're considering purchasing the digital version of Donkey Kong Bananza, you won't need to worry about making room for it. The game weighs in at a modest 10GB, making its file size only marginally larger than the recently released Donkey Kong Country Returns HD.

Since the Switch 2 comes with 256GB of internal storage right out of the box, you'll have plenty of space on hand if you opt to go digital with Donkey Kong Bananza. However, if you do want to future-proof your system by upgrading its capacity, you'll need to get a new microSD Express card, as the Switch 2 is incompatible with standard microSD cards.

What Platforms Is Donkey Kong Bananza On?

Donkey Kong Bananza is coming exclusively to the Nintendo Switch 2, which means it will not be playable on previous Nintendo Switch systems.

Who's Developing Donkey Kong Bananza?

Nintendo has not outright confirmed which development team is behind Donkey Kong Bananza. Despite the company's secretiveness, however, there are hints that the game is being developed in-house by Nintendo EPD, the team that worked on the acclaimed Super Mario Odyssey for the original Switch.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
